alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 7:55AM EDT until April 18 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... South Branch Ontonagon near Ewen affecting Ontonagon County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint). * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Parking lot of roadside park upstream of M-69 begins to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:10 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:10 AM CDT Saturday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Monday morning and continue falling to 4.5 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.1 feet on 05/08/1975. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1000 PM CDT /1100 PM EDT/.
